row.Title: All Removable storage classes: Deny all access
row.Description: By inserting a USB stick, the IPC can be infected with a malicious program. Therefore, it is recommended to deny access to various removable disks in the Group Policy settings. It is possible to either deny read and/or write access or to deny "any access".
row.Name: DenyAll

row.Title: WPD-Devices: Deny write access
row.Description: By inserting a USB stick, the IPC can be infected with a malicious program. Therefore, it is recommended to deny access to various removable disks in the Group Policy settings. It is possible to either deny read and/or write access or to deny "any access".
row.Name: DenyWrite

row.Title: WPD Devices: Deny read access
row.Description: By inserting a USB stick, the IPC can be infected with a malicious program. Therefore, it is recommended to deny access to various removable disks in the Group Policy settings. It is possible to either deny read and/or write access or to deny "any access".
row.Name: DenyRead

row.Title: Removable Disks: Deny read access
row.Description: By inserting a USB stick, the IPC can be infected with a malicious program. Therefore, it is recommended to deny access to various removable disks in the Group Policy settings. It is possible to either deny read and/or write access or to deny "any access".
row.Name: DenyRead

row.Title: Removable Disks: Deny write access
row.Description: By inserting a USB stick, the IPC can be infected with a malicious program. Therefore, it is recommended to deny access to various removable disks in the Group Policy settings. It is possible to either deny read and/or write access or to deny "any access".
row.Name: DenyWrite

row.Title: Set the default behavior for AutoRun
row.Description: USB sticks and external hard drives may contain an autoplay file ("autorun.inf"). In this way, viruses, for example, could infect the system. The following table shows how to disable the Autoplay feature and AutoRun ("AutoRun Default Behavior" policy).
row.Name: NoDriveTypeAutoRun

row.Title: Turn off Autoplay
row.Description: USB sticks and external hard drives may contain an autoplay file ("autorun.inf"). In this way, viruses, for example, could infect the system. The following table shows how to disable the Autoplay feature and AutoRun ("AutoRun Default Behavior" policy).
row.Name: NoAutorun

row.Title: Prevent removable media source for any installation
row.Description: If it is not possible for you to prohibit access to USB media in general (see section 4.10), you should prevent software from being installed from removable media. This allows you to prevent malware or other unwanted programs from removable media from being installed on your IPC.
row.Name: DisableMedia

row.Title: Restrict the user from entering author mode
row.Description: The graphical user interface "Microsoft Management Console" (MMC) is used to manage computers and users. You can configure if and how the MMC can be used. CAUTION With this setting you deny any IPC user access to the Microsoft Management Console! You may need to restart your computer if you want to make changes to Local Computer Policies or other settings in options that are already disabled (e.g. Control Center). Disable access to this console only if you are absolutely sure that the settings are complete and correct. Later change requests
row.Name: RestrictAuthorMode

row.Title: Restrict users to the explicitly permitted list of snap-ins
row.Description: The graphical user interface "Microsoft Management Console" (MMC) is used to manage computers and users. You can configure if and how the MMC can be used. CAUTION With this setting you deny any IPC user access to the Microsoft Management Console! You may need to restart your computer if you want to make changes to Local Computer Policies or other settings in options that are already disabled (e.g. Control Center). Disable access to this console only if you are absolutely sure that the settings are complete and correct. Later change requests
row.Name: RestrictToPermittedSnapins

row.Title: Prevent restoring previous versions from backups
row.Description: By disabling the recovery options of the operating system, it is no longer possible to return to previous states of the operating system. This prevents users from undoing changes to the system.
row.Name: DisableBackupRestore

row.Title: Prevent restoring local previous versions"
row.Description: By disabling the recovery options of the operating system, it is no longer possible to return to previous states of the operating system. This prevents users from undoing changes to the system.
row.Name: DisableLocalRestore

row.Title: Prevent restoring remote previous versions
row.Description: By disabling the recovery options of the operating system, it is no longer possible to return to previous states of the operating system. This prevents users from undoing changes to the system.
row.Name: DisableRemoteRestore

row.Title: Prevent indexing certain paths
row.Description: To deny access to system paths (for example, "C:\Windows\system32"), you can explicitly specify which paths are excluded from the search.
row.Name: file:///C:\*

row.Title: Prevent indexing certain paths
row.Description: To deny access to system paths (for example, "C:\Windows\system32"), you can explicitly specify which paths are excluded from the search.
row.Name: file:///D:\*

row.Title: Remove Search button from File Explorer
row.Description: You can restrict access to drives to prevent manipulation.
row.Name: NoShellSearchButton

row.Title: No Entire Network in Network Locations
row.Description: You can restrict access to drives to prevent manipulation.
row.Name: NoEntireNetwork

row.Title: Prevent access to drives from My Computer
row.Description: You can restrict access to drives to prevent manipulation.
row.Name: C:\

row.Title: Prevent access to drives from My Computer
row.Description: You can restrict access to drives to prevent manipulation.
row.Name: D:\

row.Title: User Account Control policy setting: Behavior of the Increased rights prompt for standard users
row.Description: This function can be deactivated via the User Account Control (UAC). This means that a user with restricted rights no longer has the option of obtaining increased rights. Note Basically, you should only give your administrator passwords to authorized employees and otherwise keep them secret. This way you do not have to make this setting. This has the advantage that the admin can also make changes to the system without logging off the active user
row.Name: ConsentPromptBehaviorUser

row.Title: User Account Control: Run all administrators in administrator confirmation mode
row.Description: This function can be deactivated via the User Account Control (UAC). This means that a user with restricted rights no longer has the option of obtaining increased rights. Note Basically, you should only give your administrator passwords to authorized employees and otherwise keep them secret. This way you do not have to make this setting. This has the advantage that the admin can also make changes to the system without logging off the active user
row.Name: FilterAdministratorToken

row.Title: Do not allow the system to shut down without logging in
row.Description: With some operator stations it may be necessary to prevent the station from shutting down or to enable this option only for certain operators.
row.Name: shutdownwithlogon

row.Title: Prohibit User from manually redirecting Profile Folders
row.Name: DisablePersonalDirChange

row.Title: Disable Active Desktop
row.Name: NoActiveDesktop

row.Title: Prohibit deleting items
row.Name: NoDeletingComponents

row.Title: Prohibit editing items
row.Name: NoEditingComponents

row.Title: Disable desktop gadgets
row.Name: NoSidebar

row.Title: Hide Internet Explorer icon on desktop
row.Name: NoInternetIcon

row.Title: Remove Computer icon on desktop
row.Name: HideIcons

row.Title: Hide Network Locations icon on desktop
row.Name: NoNetHood

row.Title: Remove Properties from the Computer icon context menu
row.Name: NoPropertiesMyComputer

row.Title: Remove Properties from the Documents icon context menu
row.Name: NoPropertiesMyDocuments

row.Title: Remove Properties from the Recycle Bin context menu
row.Name: NoPropertiesRecycleBin

row.Title: Hide Recicle Bin icon on desktop
row.Name: {645FF040-5081-101B-9F08-00AA002F954E}

row.Title: Prevent adding, dragging, dropping and closing the Taskbar's Toolbars
row.Name: NoCloseDragDropBands

row.Title: Prohibit adjusting desktop toolbars
row.Name: NoMovingBands

row.Title: Remove Run menu from Start Menu
row.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
row.Name: NoRun

row.Title: Remove programs on Settings menu
row.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
row.Name: NoSetFolders

row.Title: Remove Pictures icon from Start Menu
row.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
row.Name: NoSMMyPictures

row.Title: Remove Download link from Start Menu
row.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
row.Name: NoStartMenuDownloads

row.Title: Remove Homegroup link from Start Menu
row.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
row.Name: NoStartMenuHomegroup

row.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
row.Name: NoStartMenuMyGames

row.Title: Remove Network icon from Start Menu
row.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
row.Name: NoStartMenuNetworkPlaces

row.Title: Prevent changes to Taskbar and Start Menu Settings
row.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
row.Name: NoSetTaskbar

row.Title: Remove Music icon from Start Menu
row.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
row.Name: NoStartMenuMyMusic

row.Title: Remove Network icon from Start Menu
row.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
row.Name: NoStartMenuNetworkPlaces

row.Title: Remove Recorded TV link from Start Menu
row.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
row.Name: NoStartMenuRecordedTV

row.Title: Remove and prevent access to the Shut Down, Restart, Sleep, and Hibernate commands
row.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
row.Name: HidePowerOptions

row.Title: Lock the Taskbar
row.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
row.Name: LockTaskbar

row.Title: Remove Favorites menu from Start Menu
row.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
row.Name: NoFavoritesMenu

row.Title: Remove Search link from Start Menu
row.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
row.Name: NoFind

row.Title: Remove Network Connections from Start Menu
row.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
row.Name: NoNetworkConnections

row.Title: Remove Change Password
row.Description: You can use the computer configuration to switch off the key combination <Ctrl+Alt+Del> for user logon. (Computer Configuration > Windows Settings > Security Settings > Local Policies > Security Options > Interactive Login: No STRG + ALT + ENTF required). Alternatively, you can use the user configuration to set which actions are possible when pressing <Ctrl+Alt+Del> (e.g. no access to Task Manager).
row.Name: DisableChangePassword

row.Title: Remove Lock Computer
row.Description: You can use the computer configuration to switch off the key combination <Ctrl+Alt+Del> for user logon. (Computer Configuration > Windows Settings > Security Settings > Local Policies > Security Options > Interactive Login: No STRG + ALT + ENTF required). Alternatively, you can use the user configuration to set which actions are possible when pressing <Ctrl+Alt+Del> (e.g. no access to Task Manager).
row.Name: DisableLockWorkstation

row.Title: Remove Task Manager
row.Description: You can use the computer configuration to switch off the key combination <Ctrl+Alt+Del> for user logon. (Computer Configuration > Windows Settings > Security Settings > Local Policies > Security Options > Interactive Login: No STRG + ALT + ENTF required). Alternatively, you can use the user configuration to set which actions are possible when pressing <Ctrl+Alt+Del> (e.g. no access to Task Manager).
row.Name: DisableTaskMgr

row.Title: Prohibit access to Control Panel and PC settings
row.Description: The Control Panel can be used to make unwanted changes to the system, such as network connections, uninstalling programs, etc. Access to the Control Panel should therefore be prevented
row.Name: NoControlPanel

row.Title: Turn off Internet File Association service
row.Description: The denial of Internet access limits the possibilities for unwanted installation of malware on the IPC.
row.Name: NoInternetOpenWith

row.Title: Turn off the "Order Prints" picture task
row.Description: The denial of Internet access limits the possibilities for unwanted installation of malware on the IPC.
row.Name: NoOnlinePrintsWizard

row.Title: Turn off Internet download for Web publishing and online ordering wizards
row.Description: The denial of Internet access limits the possibilities for unwanted installation of malware on the IPC.
row.Name: NoPublishingWizard

row.Title: Turn off the "Publish to Web" task for files and folders
row.Description: The denial of Internet access limits the possibilities for unwanted installation of malware on the IPC.
row.Name: NoWebServices

row.Title: Turn off the Windows Messenger Customer Experience Improvement Program
row.Description: The denial of Internet access limits the possibilities for unwanted installation of malware on the IPC.
row.Name: CEIP

row.Title: Turn off Help Ratings
row.Description: The denial of Internet access limits the possibilities for unwanted installation of malware on the IPC.
row.Name: NoExplicitFeedback

row.Title: Turn off Help Experience Improvement Program
row.Description: The denial of Internet access limits the possibilities for unwanted installation of malware on the IPC.
row.Name: NoImplicitFeedback

row.Title: Turn off Windows Online"
row.Description: The denial of Internet access limits the possibilities for unwanted installation of malware on the IPC.
row.Name: NoOnlineAssist

row.Title: Remove access to use all Windows Update features
row.Description: If system updates are performed automatically, an unwanted restart of the system may occur. You can prevent this by configuring Windows Updates not to run automatically.
row.Name: SetDisableUXWUAccess

row.Title: Configure Automatic Updates
row.Description: If system updates are performed automatically, an unwanted restart of the system may occur. You can prevent this by configuring Windows Updates not to run automatically.
row.Name: NoAutoUpdate

row.Title: Do not allow passwords to be saved
row.Description: To be able to use the remote desktop connection for a restricted user account (without administrator rights), the corresponding user must be added under "Select user...". You can use Group Policy to extend the settings for Remote Desktop Services. By default, the listed settings are not configured. To ensure a higher security of the connection, it is recommended to use the NTLM protocol and not to allow storing passwords. How to enable these options is explained in the section "Advanced Remote Desktop Settings".
row.Name: DisablePasswordSaving

row.Title: Set RD Gateway authentication method
row.Description: To be able to use the remote desktop connection for a restricted user account (without administrator rights), the corresponding user must be added under "Select user...". You can use Group Policy to extend the settings for Remote Desktop Services. By default, the listed settings are not configured. To ensure a higher security of the connection, it is recommended to use the NTLM protocol and not to allow storing passwords. How to enable these options is explained in the section "Advanced Remote Desktop Settings".
row.Name: LogonMethod

row.Title: Disable powershell and command prompt unsigned scripts execution
row.Description: Disable execution of scripts. This entry should be executed last to avoid problems.
row.Name: EnableScripts

row.Title: Disable powershell and command prompt unsigned scripts execution
row.Description: Disable execution of scripts. This entry should be executed last to avoid problems.
row.Name: ExecutionPolicy

row.Title: Disable Internet Explorer and Microsoft Edge
row.Description: Function to disable Internet explorer
row.Name: NotifyDisableIEOptions
